channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: RFK Jr. says he'll fix the overdose crisis. Critics say his plan is risky
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. survived heroin addiction and says that if confirmed as head of the Department of Health and Human Services, he'll build treatment "farms" to help people recover.
item.content:encoded:
Robert F. Kennedy Jr. survived heroin addiction and says that if confirmed as head of the Department of Health and Human Services, he'll build treatment "farms" to help people recover.

(Image credit: John Nacion)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: 66 million years ago, a fish chewed up and spit out food. It's now a fossil in Denmark
item.description: The fossil was found at a cliff in Denmark. Fossilized vomit is called regurgitalite, and it's a type of trace fossil, which tells scientists about an organism's daily life.
item.content:encoded:
The fossil was found at a cliff in Denmark. Fossilized vomit is called regurgitalite, and it's a type of trace fossil, which tells scientists about an organism's daily life.

(Image credit: Sten Lennart Jakobsen)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: Trump signs an order restricting gender-affirming care for minors
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order seeking to end gender-affirming medical treatments for children and teenagers under the age of 19.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump signed an executive order seeking to end gender-affirming medical treatments for children and teenagers under the age of 19.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis/AP)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: With a new home for DOGE in the White House, here's what you need to know
item.description: The Department of Government Efficiency, a post-election promise brought to life by President Trump via executive order looks different than its original proposal to broadly cut federal spending.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Government Efficiency, a post-election promise brought to life by President Trump via executive order looks different than its original proposal to broadly cut federal spending.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Country singer Charley Crockett is 'afraid of getting fenced in'
item.description: Charley Crockett has come a long way from his days busking on the streets of New Orleans. Now, he performs at theaters in front of thousands of people. To cap it all off, he's up for his first Grammy.
item.content:encoded:
Charley Crockett has come a long way from his days busking on the streets of New Orleans. Now, he performs at theaters in front of thousands of people. To cap it all off, he's up for his first Grammy.

(Image credit: Raymond Alva for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Christopher Intagliata

item.title: Step inside the secret lab where America tests its nukes
item.description: A thousand feet beneath the desert, the United States conducts experiments to verify that its weapons work. But some fear a live test could come soon.
item.content:encoded: A thousand feet beneath the desert, the United States conducts experiments to verify that its weapons work. But some fear a live test could come soon.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Nearly 5 years after schools closed, the nation gets a new report card
item.description: There's some good news in math, mostly bad news in reading and lots of questions about why students are still struggling.
item.content:encoded:
There's some good news in math, mostly bad news in reading and lots of questions about why students are still struggling.

(Image credit: Newsday LLC)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Here's how climate change fueled the Los Angeles fires
item.description: Extreme conditions helped fuel the fast-moving fires that destroyed thousands of homes. Scientists are working to figure out how climate change played a role in the disaster.
item.content:encoded:
Extreme conditions helped fuel the fast-moving fires that destroyed thousands of homes. Scientists are working to figure out how climate change played a role in the disaster.

(Image credit: PATRICK T. FALLON/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: Several people are feared dead in a stampede at massive festival in India
item.description: Millions continued to throng the site even as police urged them to avoid the area. Deadly stampedes are relatively common around Indian religious festivals, where large crowds gather in small areas.
item.content:encoded:
Millions continued to throng the site even as police urged them to avoid the area. Deadly stampedes are relatively common around Indian religious festivals, where large crowds gather in small areas.

(Image credit: Deepak Sharma)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why members of two of EPA's influential science advisory committees were let go
item.description: Acting EPA Administrator James Payne sent an email to members of the agency's Science Advisory Board and the Clean Air Scientific Advisory Committee informing them that both are being "reset."
item.content:encoded:
Acting EPA Administrator James Payne sent an email to members of the agency's Science Advisory Board and the Clean Air Scientific Advisory Committee informing them that both are being "reset."

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda
